title: Analyst Expects iPhone 8 Display to Not be as Curved as Samsung Galaxy S8
text:
Analyst Expects iPhone 8 Display to Not be as Curved as Samsung Galaxy S8 Posted by Evan Selleck on Mar 30, 2017 | No Comments Shares 111 
Yesterday, Samsung officially unveiled the Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8+, both of which feature curved-edge displays. 
And while rumors have suggested, on more than one occasion, that Apple plans on featuring a curved display in the upcoming iPhone 8 , a new analyst report suggests those curves might not be be as prominent as Samsung’s. More than that, though, the lack of curves may mean Apple’s upcoming flagship iPhone may not be as “edge-to-edge” as previous rumors have suggested (which would line up with an earlier rumor ): 
“While Apple’s new OLED form factor looks similar, current indications are for less use of curved OLED which may result in a slightly less “infinity” screen form factor.” 
The analyst, Rod Hall of JP Morgan, has also said that he expects the entire line of iPhones to see their price expand moving forward, and that the high-end OLED iPhone 8 will indeed start at $1,000 . Hall doesn’t articulate what the new prices will look like, however. He does believe that Apple will stick to 3GB of RAM for the high-end models, though. Like this post? Share it!
